page.title: 14VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: The facilities for children are few, and maybe this accounts for the amount of vandalism in the village. The recreation ground is ideal for some children, but not for the older ones. The public swimming baths are two miles away in Thorne. It is very cheap to travel to Thorne on the bus, costing only two pence there and two pence back for children. The bus system which serves Moorends is quite good. Buses arrive every twenty minutes on week-days and Sundays, but every fifteen minutes on Saturdays due to the fact that lots more people use the buses to travel to Thorne and Doncaster on this day. During the past year the village has been greatly affected by the miners strike, which hit the village very hard indeed.
